p: With regard to the hyssop growing in Serbia, Mitić et al. (2000) identified cis-pinocamphone (44.7%) as the most abundant constituent of its essential oil, followed by trans-pinocamphone (14.1%), germacren-D-11-ol (5.7%) and elemol (5.6%) [ 19]. Gorunović et al. (1995) examined hyssop from the territory of Montenegro. The main constituents were methyl eugenol (38.30%), limonene (37.40%) and β-pinene (9.6%) [ 20].
